## Potential Rules for Cancer-Associated Fibroblasts (CAFs) in Response to Tgfb2: **Rule 1:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases α-SMA expression. **Justification:** Multiple studies have shown that TGF-β1, a member of the TGF-β family, can induce the differentiation of fibroblasts into myofibroblasts, which are characterized by the expression of α-SMA. [Document 2, 7, 16, 25, 27, 32, 40, 46, 50, 53, 56, 62, 67, 71] While the specific effects of TGF-β2 on α-SMA expression are not explicitly stated in the provided documents, it is reasonable to assume that TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, would have a similar effect. **Rule 2:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases collagen production. **Justification:** TGF-β1 is a potent inducer of collagen production in fibroblasts. [Document 2, 21, 25, 27, 32, 40, 49, 53, 62, 67, 71, 74] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on collagen production. **Rule 3:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the secretion of CXCL12. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the secretion of CXCL12 in fibroblasts. [Document 16, 25, 30, 33, 46, 50, 56, 61, 62, 68, 70] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on CXCL12 secretion. **Rule 4:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of FSP1 (S100A4). **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of FSP1 (S100A4) in fibroblasts. [Document 25, 33, 40, 50, 56, 61, 62, 70] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on FSP1 expression. **Rule 5:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of PDGFRβ. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of PDGFRβ in fibroblasts. [Document 2, 25, 33, 40, 50, 56, 61, 62, 70] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on PDGFRβ expression. **Rule 6:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of MMP2. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of MMP2 in fibroblasts. [Document 16, 25, 33, 40, 46, 49, 50, 53, 56, 61, 62, 63, 67, 71, 74] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on MMP2 expression. **Rule 7:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of MMP9. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of MMP9 in fibroblasts. [Document 16, 25, 33, 40, 46, 49, 50, 53, 56, 61, 62, 63, 67, 71, 74] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on MMP9 expression. **Rule 8:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of IL-6. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of IL-6 in fibroblasts. [Document 16, 25, 30, 33, 40, 46, 50, 53, 56, 61, 62, 67, 71] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on IL-6 expression. **Rule 9:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of IL-8. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of IL-8 in fibroblasts. [Document 16, 25, 30, 33, 40, 46, 50, 53, 56, 61, 62, 63, 67, 71] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on IL-8 expression. **Rule 10:** In cancer-associated fibroblasts, Tgfb2 increases the expression of PDGFRα. **Justification:** TGF-β1 has been shown to induce the expression of PDGFRα in fibroblasts. [Document 2, 25, 33, 40, 50, 56, 61, 62, 70] TGF-β2, as a member of the same family, is likely to have a similar effect on PDGFRα expression. **Note:** These rules are based on the assumption that TGF-β2 would have similar effects to TGF-β1. Further research is needed to confirm these rules and to investigate the specific effects of TGF-β2 on CAF behavior.
